questions.question_text:
Files arrive in an external stage every 10 seconds from a proprietary system. The files range in size from 500 K to 3 MB. The data must be accessible by dashboards as soon as it arrives.
How can a Snowflake Architect meet this requirement with the LEAST amount of coding? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
According to following statement "C" is correct, but I am not 100% sure, if this logic applied here:
"In many cases, the Materialized view on an external table can provide performance that is faster than equivalent queries over the underline External table. "

AC
Task is using cronjob syntax, which means minimum interval is 60 seconds

Selected Answer: AE
A&E is my guess

comments.content:
Sorry, I think STREAM_HAS_DATA can not change the scheduling of a task:
This function is intended to be used in the WHEN expression in the definition of tasks. If the specified stream contains no change data, the task skips the current run.

And this can not be correct because of the charemski comment.
I think this is also true but the question says: with the LEAST amount of coding

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: AE
A is definitely valid
Correct me if I'm wrong. E is also valid because if we set STREAM_HAS_DATA it will trigger the task to run to insert data although schedule has been set.

Selected Answer: AC
Minimum schedule time for a task is 60 seconds, so in this case only Snowpipe or Materialized View on External Table, in either case using event notification service 
https://docs.snowflake.com/en/user-guide/tables-external-intro#materialized-views-over-external-tables

comments.content: COPY command does not exist (option b).

discussion.content: Answer is A,B and is validated

Selected Answer: AB
A: Just define one object: the Pipe object with included COPY INTO ... FROM Stage ... command
B: Just define one object: the scheduled Task object with included COPY INTO ... FROM Stage ... command

comments.content: A & E is the right answer

discussion.content: I think A & C are the answers

choices.C: Use a materialized view on an external table.
choices.B: Use a COPY command with a task.
choices.E: Use a combination of a task and a stream.

choices.C: Any rows loaded using a specific COPY statement will have varying timestamps based on when the rows were created in the source.
choices.B: Any rows loaded using a specific COPY statement will have varying timestamps based on when the rows were read from the source.
choices.D: All rows loaded using a specific COPY statement will have the same timestamp value.
choices.A: All rows loaded using a specific COPY statement will have varying timestamps based on when the rows were inserted.

questions.question_text: When loading data into a table that captures the load time in a column with a default value of either CURRENT_TIME() or CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() what will occur?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
Validated and a bit helpful:
https://docs.snowflake.com/en/user-guide/data-load-transform#current-time-current-timestamp-default-column-values
Answer is D and is validated
I think C is the Answer
Answer is D and is validated

Selected Answer: D
Standard (default)
Prevents/minimizes queuing by favoring starting additional clusters over conserving credits.

Selected Answer: D
https://docs.snowflake.com/en/user-guide/warehouses-multicluster#label-mcw-scaling-policies

questions.question_text: How does a standard virtual warehouse policy work in Snowflake?

choices.A: It conserves credits by keeping running clusters fully loaded rather than starting additional clusters.
choices.C: It starts only f the system estimates that there is a query load that will keep the cluster busy for at least 2 minutes.
choices.D: It prevents or minimizes queuing by starting additional clusters instead of conserving credits.
choices.B: It starts only if the system estimates that there is a query load that will keep the cluster busy for at least 6 minutes.

questions.question_text: Which feature provides the capability to define an alternate cluster key for a table with an existing cluster key?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
The answer is B
Answer is B and is validated
B is the answer
i think its B

Selected Answer: D
Answer is D. Clone table and afterwards delete data older than the previous 6 years.

questions.question_text:
An Architect would like to save quarter-end financial results for the previous six years.
Which Snowflake feature can the Architect use to accomplish this?
